locations.name: Bahen Center for Information Technology
locations.brief_description: You are on the first floor of the Bahen Center for Information Technology. There is an exit from the building to St. George Street to the east. A lost engineering calculator lies on the ground, and you spot a UofT mug on a table.
locations.long_description: You are on the first floor of the Bahen Center for Information Technology, a popular student hub. There is an exit leading to St. George Street to the east. As you look around, you notice a university-issued engineering calculator on the ground—someone must have dropped it. Nearby, a familiar blue UofT mug sits abandoned on a table.

locations.name: St. George St
locations.brief_description: You are standing on St. George Street, right outside of Bahen. To the west is the entrance to Bahen, to the east is the Myhal Centre, to the south is Wallberg Memorial, and to the north is Robarts Library
locations.long_description: You are standing on St. George Street, right outside of the Bahen Center. The cool breeze of downtown Toronto brushes against you. The street is bustling with students going in and out of various buildings. The entrance to Bahen is to the west, while the Myhal Centre is just ahead to the east. To the north, Robarts Library stands tall and proud.

locations.name: Robarts Library
locations.brief_description: You step inside Robarts Library, a brutalist masterpiece of a building. The exit to St. George Street is on the south and a locked study room is to the west.
locations.long_description: You step inside Robarts Library, a brutalist masterpiece of a building, known for its towering concrete walls and endless rows of bookshelves. The library is silent except for the furious typing of students working away. The exit to St. George Street is on the south and a locked study room is to the west with a keypad entry.

examinables.coffee cup: A cold half-empty latte from Starbucks. The order sticker reads: 'Venti Oat Milk Latte, 3 pumps SFV'
examinables.bookshelf: Rows of dense computer science textbooks. One title catches your eye: 'Advanced Lock Mechanisms Vol. III'
examinables.door frame: Looking closely at the door frame, you find four small numbers scratched into the paint: 7291.
examinables.table: The table's surface is covered in pencil marks and carved initials. Someone wrote 'CS > EE' in the corner

locations.name: Myhal Basement
locations.brief_description: You are in the basement of the Myhal Centre for Engineering Innovation. The exit to St. George Street is to the west, and Front Campus is to the east. The computer lab is to the south.
locations.long_description: You find yourself in the basement of the Myhal Centre for Engineering Innovation and Entrepreneurship, a more modern study space. The computer labs are nearly full, and the hum of laptop fans fills the air. The wooden finish and sleek furniture give the space a high-tech feel. The exit to St. George Street is to the west, and Front Campus is to the east. The computer lab is down south.

locations.name: Front Campus
locations.brief_description: You are at Front Campus, surrounded by historic buildings and a massive open lawn. The dorms are to the north, Myhal is to the west, and Wallberg Memorial Building is to the south.
locations.long_description: You are at Front Campus, a scenic open lawn surrounded by historic UofT buildings. Students are lying on the grass, enjoying the sun, while a group of tourists takes photos of University College. The atmosphere is peaceful, with only the occasional laughter or distant chatter. The dorms are just beyond the trees to the north, Myhal is to the east, and the Wallberg Memorial Building is further down to the south.

locations.name: Wallberg Memorial Building
locations.brief_description: You are in the Wallberg Memorial Building, where your computer science lectures take place. Front Campus is to the north. A lost student card and an old notebook are lying on a desk.
locations.long_description: You are in the Wallberg Memorial Building, a familiar place for engineering and computer science students. A lecture is currently in progress in one of the large halls. The professor is animatedly explaining a complex formula on the board, while a few students whisper to each other, trying to decipher their notes. Others have resigned themselves to zoning out, their eyes drifting toward the clock, counting down the minutes until the lecture ends. Front campus is to the North. On a nearby desk, you notice a student card belonging to someone named Paul. Beside it, an old, worn-out notebook filled with cryptic equations and lecture notes lies abandoned.

locations.name: Your Dorm
locations.brief_description: You are in your dorm room, your own little corner of campus. There's an exist to the south that leads to St. George Street.
locations.long_description: You are in your dorm room, a small but cozy space cluttered with textbooks, empty coffee cups, and a few too many unfinished assignments. Your desk is a chaotic mix of open notebooks and tangled charger cables. The bed is unmade, and your laundry situation is starting to get out of control. Despite the mess, it feels like home. There's an exist to the south that leads to St. George Street

locations.name: Robarts Study Room
locations.brief_description: A private study room with your laptop charger on the table. You enter with the student card you picked up
locations.long_description: You use the student card you found to enter the study room contains your missing laptop charger!

locations.name: Myhal Computer Lab
locations.brief_description: A secure computer lab with your USB drive visible in a workstation.
locations.long_description: Rows of powerful computers hum quietly in this restricted lab. You spot your USB drive plugged into one of the workstations!

items.name: engineering calculator
items.description: A high-end engineering calculator, probably left behind by a stressed-out student. It should be returned to the Myhal Basement where engineering students study.

items.name: lost student card
items.description: A student card belonging to someone named Paul. It should probably be returned to Lost & Found in Robarts Library.

items.name: usb drive
items.description: Your USB drive! You can’t believe you found it. The only copy of your game—safe at last. You make a mental note to back it up the second you get back to your dorm. No more near-heart attacks.

items.name: laptop charger
items.description: Your laptop charger! You were sure it was gone forever, but here it is. No more frantic battery-saving mode. You're back in business!

items.name: uoft mug
items.description: Your lucky UofT mug! You were starting to accept that it was lost to the universe, but here it is in the library where you must've left it last night. Crisis averted.

items.name: old notebook
items.description: A worn-out notebook filled with cryptic equations and lecture notes. Someone must have abandoned it. You should leave it in the lecture hall in case they come back for it. As you glance at the pages, you notice some hastily scribbled notes in the margins. It looks like a sequence of numbers…
